description: Current tabs show connection strings but NO guidance. Each service tab needs: "What is this?", "When to use it?", Quick integration code, SDK installation, Connection details. This reduces friction and helps developers understand each service.

userStories.title: Create Service Tab Template
userStories.description: As a UI developer, I want a reusable service tab template so that all service tabs have consistent structure.
acceptanceCriteria: Sections: Overview, Quick Start, Connection Details, Docs Link
userStories.notes: Completed: Created ServiceTab component at src/components/ServiceTab.tsx with consistent sections (Overview, When to Use, Quick Start, Connection Details, Documentation Link). Component uses TypeScript with proper type definitions. All sections clearly defined. Typecheck passes.

userStories.title: Enhance Database Tab
userStories.description: As a developer, I want database tab guidance so that I understand how to use the database service.
acceptanceCriteria: PostgreSQL-powered data with auto-generated REST & GraphQL APIs
Code example: client initialization and query
userStories.notes: Completed: Enhanced database tab using ServiceTab component with all required sections - Overview explaining PostgreSQL-powered data with auto-generated REST & GraphQL APIs, When to use it section with use cases, Quick Start with installation (npm install nextmavens-js), client initialization, and query examples. Connection details include database URL, REST/GraphQL endpoints, and security warning. Full documentation link included.

userStories.title: Enhance Auth Tab
userStories.description: As a developer, I want auth tab guidance so that I understand how to implement authentication.
userStories.notes: Completed: Enhanced auth tab using ServiceTab component with all required sections - Overview explaining user authentication with JWT tokens, When to use it section with use cases, Quick Start with installation (@nextmavens/auth), client initialization, sign up, and sign in examples. Connection details include auth endpoint with copy button, link to user management UI in Studio Console, token type (JWT RS256), and token expiration (1 hour). Full documentation link included. Typecheck passes.

userStories.title: Enhance Storage Tab
userStories.description: As a developer, I want storage tab guidance so that I understand how storage abstraction works.
acceptanceCriteria: Transparent: Telegram for raw files, Cloudinary for optimized
userStories.notes: Completed: Enhanced storage tab using ServiceTab component with all required sections - Overview explaining transparent storage abstraction (Telegram for raw files, Cloudinary for optimized), When to use it section with use cases, Quick Start with installation (@nextmavens/storage), client initialization, upload file, and get public URL examples. Connection details include storage endpoint with copy button, link to bucket management in Studio Console, raw storage (Telegram), and CDN/optimization (Cloudinary). Full documentation link included. Typecheck passes.

userStories.title: Enhance Realtime Tab
userStories.description: As a developer, I want realtime tab guidance so that I understand how to use WebSocket subscriptions.
userStories.notes: Completed: Enhanced realtime tab using ServiceTab component with all required sections - Overview explaining PostgreSQL-change-data-capture to WebSocket subscriptions, When to use it section with use cases, Quick Start with installation (@nextmavens/realtime), client initialization, WebSocket connection, and table subscription examples. Connection details include WebSocket URL with copy button, CDC explanation, protocol (WebSocket), and latency (<100ms). Full documentation link included. Typecheck passes.

userStories.title: Enhance GraphQL Tab
userStories.description: As a developer, I want GraphQL tab guidance so that I understand how to use GraphQL API.
userStories.notes: Completed: Enhanced GraphQL tab using ServiceTab component with all required sections - Overview explaining auto-generated GraphQL from database schema, When to use it section with use cases, Quick Start with installation (@nextmavens/graphql), client initialization, query example (with nested relations), and mutation example (with nested insert). Connection details include GraphQL endpoint with copy button, link to GraphQL Playground, auto-generated schema, and WebSocket subscriptions (Realtime). Full documentation link included. Typecheck passes.

userStories.title: Enhance API Keys Tab
userStories.description: As a developer, I want API keys tab guidance so that I understand which key type to use.
acceptanceCriteria: Quick integration code for each type
userStories.notes: Completed: Enhanced API Keys tab with comprehensive guidance section. Added key type explanations (publishable, secret, service_role) with when-to-use guidance for each, security best practices warning with 5 key recommendations, and quick integration code examples for SDK and REST API with copy buttons. All acceptance criteria met: key type explanations, when to use each type, security warnings, scope explanations (via key types), environment selector (already present in create key modal), and quick integration code. Typecheck passes.

userStories.title: Add Copy Buttons to Code Examples
userStories.description: As a developer, I want copy buttons on code examples so that I can quickly copy integration code.
acceptanceCriteria: Copy button on each code block

userStories.title: Add Language Selector for Examples
userStories.description: As a developer, I want to choose example language so that I see relevant code for my stack.
acceptanceCriteria: Code examples update based on selection

userStories.title: Add Service Status Indicators
userStories.description: As a developer, I want to see service status so that I know if a service is enabled.
acceptanceCriteria: Status indicator on each service tab

userStories.title: Add Quick Actions
userStories.description: As a developer, I want quick action buttons so that I can perform common tasks without navigating away.
acceptanceCriteria: "Open GraphQL Playground" button on GraphQL tab
